Filling in for Rush on Monday, guest-host Mark Steyn took the news of Eminem's Detroit-is-back Super Bowl ad and Chrysler-Fiat CEO Sergio Marchionne 's`` shyster loan'' comment and went to town on Detroit. Unlike European cities, no bombs fell on this American city, this American city did it to themselves, he said, taking offense at the ad's protrayal of Detroit as a comeback city. He also zeroed in on Chrysler for taking corporate welfare then spending$ 9 million of it on a Super Bowl ad.

is that Eric Schmidt has had more than his fair share of PR and technological blunders as head of Google, and it was time for him to go. and Congress. On Dec. 10, Sen. Bernie Sanders , an independent, took the floor of the Senate and didn't relinquish it for 8 1/2 hours. His words are being assembled into a book entitled The Speech: A Historic Filibuster on Corporate Greed and the Decline of Our Middle Class. Times begins its story with Donald Rumsfeld 's account about being told by President Bush , two weeks after the 9/11 attacks, to prepare review the Pentagon's plans for a war with Iraq.
